channel.title: Proteomics on CityU-Bioinformatics
channel.description: Recent content in Proteomics on CityU-Bioinformatics

item.title: Immune System
item.description: Table of Contents Immune System Analysis Sequence-based B-cell Epitope Prediction Structure-based B-cell Epitope Prediction Antibody Structure Prediction MHC Class I Epitope Prediction MHC Class II Epitope Prediction Flow Cytometry Cell Population Identification Data Repositories Utilities Mass Cytometry Peptide Array Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Immune System Analysis Immunoinformatics involves the application of computational methods to immunological problems. Prediction of B- and T-cell epitopes has long been the focus of immunoinformatics, given the potential translational implications, and many tools have been developed.

item.title: Membrane Protein
item.description: Table of Contents Membrane Protein Analysis Membrane Protein-protein Docking Membrane Simulation Transmembrane Beta-barrel Prediction Transmembrane Helix Prediction Function Membrane Protein FRAP Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Membrane Protein Analysis Membrane and transmembrane proteins are key component of cell signaling. Their configuration, folding, or activity depend on several biochemical factors that can be predicted by specific software. Membrane Protein-protein Docking Membrane Simulation Transmembrane Beta-barrel Prediction Transmembrane Helix Prediction Function Membrane Protein FRAP Top

item.title: Prediction of Protein Structure
item.description: This part may contains the following tools: (Will be filled in the future) Primary structure ProtParam COILS Secondary structure PredictProtein PSIPRED tertiary structure Phyre Swiss-PdbViewer Top Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Image Citation

item.title: Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents Protein Interactions Analysis Protein-DNA Interaction Prediction Protein-RNA Interaction Prediction Pocket Detection Drug-target Interaction Prediction Protein-protein Interaction Prediction Protein-ligand Docking Protein-protein Docking FRET Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Protein Interactions Analysis Proteins interact with nucleic acids, other proteins, ligands, metal ions, to exert their biological functions. Mass-spectrometry and protein chips have revolutionized the field of proteomics and the study of protein interactions to a wider scale, which require specific tools for their analyses.

item.title: Protein Sequence/Expression
item.description: Table of Contents Protein Sequence Analysis Amino Acid Repeat Prediction Subcellular Localizaton Prediction T3S effector Prediction Protein Clustering SDS Prediction MS-based (Mass Spectrometry) untargeted Proteomics 2D gel Image Analysis In Silico Analysis Phosphorylation Site Assignment PTM Identification Glycosylation Identification MS-based Metaproteomics Antibody Array Analysis Proteogenomics Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Protein Sequence Analysis Protein sequence analysis tools are used to predict specific functions, activities, origin, or localization of proteins based on their amino-acid sequence.
